feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued May 31 at 5:46PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM AKDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Lower Yukon and associated tributaries from Graying downstream to the Yukon Delta as far as Nunam Iqua and Kotlik. * WHEN...Until 400 PM AKDT Saturday.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued May 31 at 3:40PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM AKDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...Crooked Creek near Central. * WHEN...Until 315 PM AKDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued May 31 at 2:57PM AKDT until June 01 at 10:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 AM AKDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Rain transitioning to snow before midnight. Snow accumulations around 1 to 2 inches. * WHERE...Copper River Basin, mainly through the higher elevations of the Richardson, Glenn, and Tok Cutoff Highways.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 2:54PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Chilly Temperatures and Light Frost in Colder Spots Tonight... Skies will clear out somewhat and winds will become light tonight. The usual colder locations around Fox, North Pole, and Salcha may see a light frost. Residents with gardening interests should take precautions to protect any sensitive plants.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Middle Tanana Valley

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 1:47PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Gulkana River Rises Expected... Renewed river rises are expected on the Gulkana River through the next few days based on runoff from recent precipitation. River levels will be near bankfull and some flooding of low areas and rural roads near the river will be possible, as water routes through the system.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 3:19AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow Wednesday Through Friday... A cold front will bring Snow and blowing snow to the Eastern Brooks range Today then another front will push through Thursday night into Friday. There could be 2 to 4 inches of snow in the lower elevations, with up to 6 inches near Atigun Pass. Blowing snow could reduce visibility at times. This could make travel

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued May 31 at 12:09PM MDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Utah... Duchesne River near Randlett affecting Uintah County. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt snowpack and increase river and stream flows. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by snowmelt will continue.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued May 31 at 10:36AM MDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Utah... Sevier River Near Hatch affecting Piute, Kane, Garfield, Iron and Sevier Counties. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt snowpack, causing elevated flows. For the Sevier River...including Hatch...Minor flooding is forecast

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued May 31 at 10:25AM MDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Utah... Bear River At Corinne affecting Box Elder County. .Snow melt and increased reservoir releases will cause the river flows to become high. Expect minor flooding downstream from the dam. For the Bear River...including Corinne...elevated but decreasing river levels are forecast.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued May 31 at 10:15AM MDT until June 03 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Utah... Logan River Near Logan affecting Cache County. For the Logan River...including Logan...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Continued high flows remaining near bankfull.

entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Utah... Logan River Near Logan affecting Cache County. Minor flooding is forecast to return to the Logan River near Logan beginning as early as Tuesday. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.

Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result.

entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM CDT THIS EVENING... The Wisconsin Department of Natural Resources has issued an Air Quality Advisory FOR Ozone...in effect until 11 PM CDT this evening. entry.title: Flood Advisory issued May 31 at 11:03AM MDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following river in Wyoming... Pacific Creek near Moran affecting Teton County. .Mountain snowmelt continues before cooler weather arrives to end the week. While this slows the snowmelt, rain showers are expected into the weekend. Overall, water levels on Pacific Creek will show little change through the weekend.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued May 31 at 10:59AM MDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The National Weather Service in Riverton continues a Flood Advisory for the following river in Wyoming... Salt River near Etna affecting Lincoln County. .Mountain snowmelt continues before cooler weather arrives to end the week. While this slows the snowmelt, rain showers are expected into the weekend. Overall, river levels will show little change

entry.title: Flood Warning issued May 31 at 10:55AM MDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The National Weather Service in Riverton Wyoming continues the Flood Warning for the following river in Wyoming... Bear River below Pixley Dam affecting Lincoln County. .Mountain snowmelt continues before cooler weather arrives to end the week. This will slow mountain snowmelt above 8,000 feet, decreasing flows on tributaries feeding the Bear River.
